moves.1. d4: This is a decent game where white plays a queen sac which, trough blacks blunder lead to a won game.
moves.1... d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nc6 4. Nf3: The queens gambit declined. (I think thats what it is called)
moves.4... dxc4 5. e4 e5: Computer gives this as a mistake giving white a reasonable edge. It aslo loses a pawn.
moves.6. d5 Nb4 7. Nxe5 Bc5 8. Bxc4 Qf6 9. Nf3: Black castles queen side and places his rook on an open file. Perhaps playing Ne7 and trying to short castle was better.
moves.11... Ne7 12. Bg5: Gaining a tempo and developing. White now only has to get his queen out.
moves.12... Qg6 13. Qd2 f6 14. Be3 Bxe3 15. fx: If Qxe3 Nc2 fork queen and rook.
Black cant take the bishop, because Qxb4 leaves a7 and e7 attacked.
moves.19. d6: This move seems to lose a piece, but thats not the case.
moves.21... Rxd2: Black accepts it. Here black still has a chance for an equal game.
moves.22. Rf8+ Qe8: Only move to stay in game.
moves.23. Raf1 Rxf8: And this blunder loses, best was rd8.
moves.24. Rxf8 c6 25. Rxe8+ Kc7 26. Rc8+: And black resigns due to the massive material advantage which white will have after he queens the pawn on e7.

gameName: white sacs queen, and black blunders.
